title: Smart College System — Frontend landing + demos

requirements.summary: Create a modern responsive landing site with blue/white academic theme, cards, icons, and subtle accessible animations.
acceptanceCriteria: Site uses a consistent blue/white academic visual theme across all sections (backgrounds, surfaces, typography, buttons, and links).
Responsive layouts are implemented for common breakpoints (mobile, tablet, desktop) without horizontal scrolling.
UI includes modern cards and icons for feature highlights.
Section transitions / element entrances include subtle smooth animations without harming performance or accessibility (prefers-reduced-motion respected).

file_operations.description: Create global Tailwind + shadcn token setup and define blue/white theme CSS variables (primary/surfaces/typography/spacing), plus focus styles and motion-reduce rules for animations.
Implement the single-page responsive layout shell (header + sections + footer) with consistent card-based styling, icon usage, and motion-safe animations across sections.
Add a reusable section wrapper (consistent max-width, spacing, semantic headings, and optional motion-safe entrance animation) to keep layout and typography cohesive.
Add a lightweight intersection-observer-based reveal wrapper that applies Tailwind motion-safe animations and respects prefers-reduced-motion.

requirements.summary: Implement the landing page sections with the required English copy: Hero, Features, Dashboard Preview, Benefits, About & Future Scope, Contact form, and Footer with social links.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section renders the exact headline string provided.
Each required section is present and reachable via scrolling; optional top navigation anchors (if added) scroll to the correct sections.
All user-facing copy is in English.
Footer contains at least 3 social links (placeholders allowed) and standard footer metadata (e.g., copyright).

file_operations.description: Wire all required sections in the correct order with English user-facing copy and stable section IDs for anchor navigation (Hero, Features, Dashboard Preview, Benefits, About & Future Scope, Contact, Footer).
Add the Hero section with the exact headline “Smart College System – AI-Powered Education Management”, supporting subtext, and CTA buttons that scroll to relevant sections.
Add a Benefits section with three audience columns/cards (Students, Faculty, Admin) using consistent iconography and card styling.
Add About & Future Scope content describing the system and conceptual AI directions in education (English copy, semantic headings).
Create a footer with at least three social links (placeholders allowed) and standard metadata.

requirements.summary: Showcase seven core modules as feature cards/tiles with distinct icons and concise descriptions matching the requested capabilities.
acceptanceCriteria: All seven modules are shown with distinct icons and short descriptions.

Each module description mentions the specific capabilities stated by the user (e.g., attendance tracking/marks for Student Portal; courses/fees/timetable/exams/results/campus services for Chatbot; charts/trends/risk prediction for Analytics, etc.).
Layout remains readable and well-spaced on mobile and desktop (no cramped cards, no overflow).

file_operations.description: Implement the Features section using a responsive grid of seven cards with distinct icons and descriptions covering the exact module capabilities.
Create a reusable feature card component (icon + title + concise description) with consistent spacing, hover/focus states, and motion-safe micro-interactions.
Wire FeaturesSection into the page flow and ensure its anchor ID matches navigation links.

requirements.summary: Create a Dashboard Preview section with static screenshot-style mockups and captions for student performance, attendance, notifications, and analytics.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard Preview section includes at least 2 mock screenshot panels and short captions describing what each panel represents.
Mockups render crisply on retina displays and scale down appropriately on mobile.

file_operations.description: Add a Dashboard Preview section that renders the static images frontend/public/assets/generated/dashboard-mockup-1.dim_1400x900.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/dashboard-mockup-2.dim_1400x900.png with captions for performance, attendance/marks, notifications, and analytics.
Wire DashboardPreviewSection into the page and ensure responsive layout (stack on mobile, side-by-side on desktop) with crisp image rendering.

requirements.summary: Add a Face Recognition Attendance (Concept/Demo) section with camera UI mockup and a clear step-by-step workflow visualization (conceptual only).
acceptanceCriteria: Section explicitly indicates this is a concept/demo and does not claim real biometric processing.
Camera UI mockup visual is displayed along with a clear multi-step workflow (e.g., Capture → Detect → Match → Mark Attendance).

file_operations.description: Implement the Face Recognition Attendance (Concept/Demo) section including explicit demo disclaimer text plus the static visuals frontend/public/assets/generated/face-attendance-camera-mock.dim_1200x800.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/face-attendance-workflow.dim_1400x320.png.
Wire FaceAttendanceDemoSection into the page flow (near related Features/Analytics) and ensure responsive scaling and captions.

requirements.summary: Implement two interactive demos: a rule-based Smart Admissions eligibility checker and a fixed-intent FAQ Chatbot UI mock (no external AI calls).
acceptanceCriteria: Admissions checker accepts inputs for marks, category, and course preference and returns an immediate eligibility outcome (rules can be simplified but must be deterministic and clearly explained in UI).
Chatbot mock supports at least 8 predefined Q&A intents spanning the listed topics; unknown queries receive a friendly fallback response.
No external API calls are used for AI responses.

file_operations.description: Create a combined section that contains both interactive demos (Admissions checker + Chatbot mock) with clear headings and short explanatory copy emphasizing conceptual/rule-based behavior.
Implement a client-side admissions checker form (marks, category, course preference) with deterministic rules and an on-screen explanation of how eligibility is computed.
Implement a chatbot UI mock with at least 8 predefined intents covering courses, fees, timetable, exams, results, and campus services, plus a friendly fallback for unknown queries; no external calls.
Wire InteractiveDemosSection into the page and ensure it remains usable on mobile (stacked layout, accessible inputs).

requirements.summary: Create a Contact form UI that validates inputs and submits via the existing backend capability, showing clear success/error states.
acceptanceCriteria: Contact form validates required fields and basic email format before submit.
On submit, the frontend calls the backend to store the message and displays a success confirmation state.
Backend exposes an update method to create a contact message and a query method to list messages (for future admin use); the UI does not need an admin page unless added incidentally.
Data persists across page reloads.

file_operations.description: Implement the Contact section with name/email/subject/message fields, client-side validation, submit state (loading), and success/error confirmation UI.
Add a dedicated ContactForm component that calls the backend capability submitContactForm via the existing actor hook (useActor), handles boolean success response, and surfaces errors gracefully.
Create a React Query mutation hook that uses useActor to invoke submitContactForm and standardizes loading/success/error behavior for the Contact form.
Wire ContactSection into the page with a stable anchor ID for navigation.

requirements.summary: Establish and apply a cohesive UI token system (colors, typography scale, spacing, button/card styles) aligned with an innovative, trustworthy blue/white MVP demo look.
acceptanceCriteria: A single consistent visual system is evident across all sections (same button styles, same card treatments, consistent headings/body sizing).
Blue/white remains the dominant palette; any additional accent color is used sparingly and consistently.
Icons, cards, and charts feel cohesive and not mismatched in style.

file_operations.description: Define/adjust shared UI tokens using CSS variables (primary/secondary/surface/muted/border/ring, typography defaults) and apply consistent base styles for headings, links, buttons, and cards.

Create a small wrapper component that composes existing shadcn UI primitives for consistent button styling across the site (do not edit files in frontend/src/components/ui). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a card wrapper component that composes existing shadcn UI primitives for consistent card surfaces/borders/shadows across sections (do not edit files in frontend/src/components/ui). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add conceptual Smart Analytics Dashboard visuals (charts/graphs) for trends, risk prediction, and improvement suggestions without external services.
acceptanceCriteria: Analytics section contains at least 2 chart-style visuals and short explanatory text for trends, risk prediction, and suggested improvements.
No third-party analytics/AI services are called from the app.

file_operations.description: Implement an Analytics section with at least two chart-style visuals (e.g., simple inline SVG charts) and explanatory text covering trends, risk prediction, and improvement suggestions (conceptual).
Create a lightweight, purely client-side chart component for trend visualization (SVG-based, responsive, accessible labels).
Create a lightweight, purely client-side chart component for conceptual risk prediction visualization (SVG-based, responsive, accessible labels).
Wire AnalyticsSection into the page and ensure it matches the overall visual system (cards, typography, colors).

requirements.summary: Add a top navigation/sticky header with anchor links and implement accessibility basics (semantics, keyboard, focus, contrast).
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation links scroll to the correct section anchors.
Interactive elements are keyboard accessible with visible focus states.
Headings follow a logical hierarchy (one H1, then H2s, etc.).
Color contrast is sufficient for primary text and buttons.

file_operations.description: Create a sticky header with navigation links to Features, Dashboard, Benefits, About, and Contact; implement keyboard-accessible links and visible focus styles.
Wire Header into the app shell and ensure each target section has matching IDs; enforce a single H1 in Hero and H2s for sections.
Ensure global focus-visible styling, adequate contrast defaults, and accessible link/button hover/focus states across the blue/white theme.

requirements.summary: Use generated images as static frontend assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: All images listed in imageRequirements.required exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are used in the relevant sections.
No backend endpoints are created for image delivery.

file_operations.description: Reference and render the static hero image frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-illustration.dim_1600x900.png in the Hero section with responsive sizing and appropriate alt text.

Reference and render frontend/public/assets/generated/dashboard-mockup-1.dim_1400x900.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/dashboard-mockup-2.dim_1400x900.png as static mockups with captions (no backend image serving).

Reference and render frontend/public/assets/generated/face-attendance-camera-mock.dim_1200x800.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/face-attendance-workflow.dim_1400x320.png as static visuals (no backend image serving).
